availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson Herd (Owsley, Kentucky, lieutenant colonel (U.S.A.). )

body.p: Owsley, Kentucky, lieutenant colonel (U.S.A.). Kentucky native. Married to Mary Herd. Father of Jesse Heard, Hampton Heard, Andrew Herd, and Rachel Herd. Married to Elizabeth Searcy in Madison, Kentucky on April 13, 1868. Farmer in Owsley, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Seventh Kentucky Volunteer Infantry as first lieutenant from August 19, 1861 to July 24, 1862. Served in the Fourteenth Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry as Captain in August 4, 1862, promoted to Lieutenant Colonel in February 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, p. 322.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, Travellers Rest, p. 339A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 213.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #000183302.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 380.
